comment._content: Thank you Library of Congress for this amazing collection. Federal dollars well spent.

comment.author: 13812504@N03
comment._content: The CAMPANIA was a ship of the Cunard line. She was pulled into the Royal Navy during WW1 and was converted into Britain's first aircraft carrier.She sank of the Firth Of Forth in 1918, after a collision with HMS REVENGE. Pictures of the conversion here: www.seayourhistory.org.uk/component/option,com_gallery2/I...

comment.author: 62657215@N00
comment._content: Here is a NY Times article dated 1914. You can sign up for a free account, if you don't have one. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9500EFDA1730E7...

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: not just any ship either, Campania was the largest and fastest passenger liner afloat when she entered service in 1893. She crossed the Atlantic in less than six days; and on her second voyage in 1893, she won the prestigious Blue Riband, previously held by the Inman Liner SS City of Paris, losing it the following year to her identical sister, Lucania.
